data.title: Outdoor Total Relaxation
data.text: Bring your lawn chairs or blanket to enjoy the music under the stars! It's BYOB for food and favorite beverages or enjoy the food of local vendors like the mainstay J Gilligans. Excellent for families, couples or singles with a variety of music. Check their website for schedule.

data.title: The Greatest Outdoors
data.text: Love this oudoor venue. A terrific spot for a community feeling. Huge selection of performing artists! Most shows are free! Lots of stuff going on around this spot. Parking can be challenging. But the fun is worth the walk. Bring chairs and insect repellent.

data.title: Fun!
data.text: Love this place!  Great free music alter the summer. A wide variety of artist, and the parking and vendors are handled excellently.

data.title: Best Free Weekend Events for the whole family
data.text: We just moved here and found out about this open amphitheater downtown Arlington.  It has free concerts of different genre for several weekends during the summer.  We've attended two weekends in a row and have not been disappointed.  Venue is free and all they ask for are donations which people freely give.  We showed up w/o anything first time and found ample places to sit.  There are vendors there you can buy shaved ice, beer, wine and food.  Second time, we brought our own lawn chairs and a cooler full of drinks.  They ask for no one to bring bottled drinks but we brought plastic cups and was fine.

data.title: Celtic Rock
data.text: Killdares were great! Fun evening for all. Glad we got to see them before they retire. Going to miss them.

data.title: Free music and a great place to hang out with friends
data.text: They have free concerts during the summer. A great place to gather with family and friends. Bring your lawn chair and cooler and you are set! They have food trucks if you want to purchase food and beverages. They have plenty of CLEAN port-a-toilets on site. They also have plenty of security on site.

data.title: Fabulous and Free
data.text: I have attended many of these free concerts (contributions are welcomed in a no pressure method) and it is a fabulous way to spend the evening. You are welcome to bring your own food and beverages but there are also concessions available for those who would rather purchase. I have also walked to local restaurants and brought my food back to the Levitt. There are portable bathrooms available but they are very clean or you can walk across the street to city hall and use the indoor facilities. Win win evening!

data.title: Free music
data.text: Free music almost all summer long. Great artist. Great family fun. Entertainment for the little ones as well. Food trucks and more.

data.title: I HAVE APPEARED ON THAT STAGE NUMEROUS TIMES!
data.text:
Each year since the Levitt Pavilion was completed, I've had the honor of sitting in Santa's Chair while participating in "The Mayor's Photos with Santa for the Disadvantage" posing for pictures and visiting with hundreds of children following the Cities Annual Christmas "Holiday Lights Parade" and Official Tree Lighting. It's awesome!

I've also appeared numerous times in the audience and had the privilege of watching and listening to
numerous performances given by a host of great musical performers. At my advanced age, I especially like those appearances made by that great "Glenn Miller Orchestra" who were most famous during the 2nd World War.   

And the most astounding fact is that it doesn't cost anyone one red cent to attend any performance at the Levitt.     So if you're an Arlington Resident or a Visitor to the city, you owe it to yourself to drop by 
any night for a performance.   You'll really enjoy yourself...especially if that night, they are presenting your kind of music.   I'll be seeing you there!

data.title: Summer fun
data.text: Very relaxing fun for the whole family & great music too! It's good to get there early to get a spot.  Fourth of July is great at Levitt Pavilion. Food trucks, drinks & restaurants within walking distance.

data.title: Great Free Venue
data.text:
Have attended multiple concerts at the Levitt Pavilion.  This is a great event for anyone looking for a cheap (its totally free!) and easy night out.

There is plenty of parking on the surrounding area.  The street right next the pavilion is shut down and there is ample seating on the grass or street.  

Pets and coolers are allowed.  Remember to bring a chair!

data.title: Free music under the stars
data.text: Join the locals here for a wide variety of live music on Sunday nights. Food and beverage vendors include local restaurants and brewpubs. Bring a chair or blanket.

data.title: FREE, FREE, FREE music under the stars
data.text:
Looking for something to do Fri, Sat, Sun evening? Come out to the Levitt Pavillion. Bring your lawn chairs, a blanket for the kiddos, food, drinks, anything you would like. You will enjoy a great concert. Look online for their schedule thru the end of July. It will start up again in the fall for a bit. 
A donation bucket is passed around half way through but it is not intrusive. No charge but donations are appreciated. Concerts start at 8 and end at 10. You will have a great time.

data.title: Warm nights, cool lawn, the big Texas sky and free music ! This is the place to be
data.text: In the spring/summer and the fall season there is music for everyone and for every taste. FREE ! What could be better. Whether your a resident or a visitor, come to the Levitt Pavilion. Wednesday is kids night but Thursday, Friday, Saturday & Sunday there are different genre's of musical talent. There is ample free parking, just bring a blanket,or lawn chair and enjoy the evening. Even though it may be hot, the shows start at 8pm and there always seems to  be a cool breeze . There are a few food trucks to enjoy a meal/snack or bring something yourself.  They do pass around a bucket for donations during the middle of the performances.  I recommend it highly.

data.title: Free concert under the stars
data.text: The city of Arlington puts on free outdoor concerts here in the summer Wednesday through Sunday. Food and drink can be brought in or bought at the venue and it is dog friendly. What a perfect way to spend a summer night!!!!!

data.title: ���������� simply outstanding
data.text: There are a lot of things to do in Arlington, Texas but the Levitt Pavilion outshines them all. Bring your blankets, chairs, beverages and friends and you will have the time of your life.

data.title: Female Fiddlers
data.text: 3500 fellow concert goers brought chairs and listened for 1 1/2hrs to this entertaining group. Weather was perfect for relaxing on the lawn in front of the outdoor stage.

data.title: Love, love, love!
data.text: Our family attends their free summer concerts, now we're hooked! I've never had a problem with security, which is policed by Arlington PD and I love that. You can bring your own ice chest with food and drinks, even alcoholic drinks and there's food trucks too. You can use City Hall's restroom a few feet from the pavilion. Both streets intersecting the pavilion are blocked so you can sit in the street if the lawn is full. Kids can bring balls and other fun things. Bring your own lawn chairs, blankets, ice chest, even pets!

data.title: Best free intertainment localy
data.text: If you like outdoor fun and concerts this is the place to go with friends or family.  I've seen some really good acts here all for free.  It is located in central Arlington and very relaxing place to go in the evening after dinner.

data.title: Great Free Family Fun
data.text: The Levitt is a treasure in the heart of Arlington.  This beautiful facility is a wonderful place for concerts for the young and more mature.  These free venues offer wonderful sound, lights, and visibility at every spot. Check out the Levitt calendar and join the fun.
